description: A bone-in rib steak, 1 ¼ to 1 ½ inches thick, will feed two Scaling up is easy; just buy a thicker steak A two-inch slab serves three to four, and it requires only a few extra minutes in the oven
title: Seared Rib Steak
title_page: Seared Rib Steak Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
A bone-in rib steak, 1 ¼ to 1 ½ inches thick, will feed two. Scaling up is easy; just buy a thicker steak. A two-inch slab serves three to four, and it requires only a few extra minutes in the oven. Then add steaks as needed, bearing in mind that each one should cook in its own skillet.
Featured in: For Your Sweetheart, And More.
Learn: How to Make Steak
